comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3220?focusedCommentId=17343181) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Do you still need this `[~pearu]`   ?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3220?focusedCommentId=17343222) by Pearu Peterson (pearu):*
`[~apitrou]` I think this issue is not about my particular needs but is more about engineering the pyarrow API for consistency/better design.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3220?focusedCommentId=17343225) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Well, even inside the C++ codebase, the `WriteAt` method is used in a single place (inside Plasma, which is deprecated). So I'm not convinced there is much point in exposing it in Python.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3220?focusedCommentId=17343226) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
I'm closing for now. Feel free to ping if there's an actual case and we can reopen.
